title: Ansible Documentation
summary: Learn how to use Ansible, a simple and powerful automation platform, with this comprehensive documentation. Find installation, configuration, usage, and development guides for Ansible and its modules, plugins, collections, and ecosystem.

title: Ansible (software) - Wikipedia
summary: Ansible is an open-source software suite that enables infrastructure as code for Unix-like and Windows systems. It is agentless, uses a declarative language, and supports multiple control nodes and dynamic inventory sources.

title: Getting started with Ansible
summary: Learn how to use Ansible to automate the management of remote systems and control their desired state. Find out how to install Ansible, create an inventory, write a playbook, and run Ansible commands on a control node.

title: GitHub - ansible/ansible: Ansible is a radically simple IT automation ...
summary: Ansible is a radically simple IT automation platform that makes your applications and systems easier to deploy and maintain. Automate everything from code deployment to network configuration to cloud management, in a language that approaches plain English, using SSH, with no agents to install on remote systems. https://docs.ansible.com. - ansible/ansible

title: Installing Ansible ‚Äî Ansible Community Documentation
summary: Installing Ansible . Ansible is an agentless automation tool that you install on a single host (referred to as the control node). From the control node, Ansible can manage an entire fleet of machines and other devices (referred to as managed nodes) remotely with SSH, Powershell remoting, and numerous other transports, all from a simple command-line interface with no databases or daemons required.

title: How Ansible Works - Ansible Collaborative
summary: Learn how Ansible is an open source IT automation software that can configure systems, deploy software, and orchestrate workflows. Compare community Ansible with Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform and explore its features and benefits.

title: Ansible Collaborative
summary: Ansible Collaborative is a destination for Ansible users, customers, partners, and vendors to learn and share automation content. It includes Ansible projects, collections, documentation, forum, and advocacy group for Policy as Code.

title: Ansible Tutorial for Beginners: Ultimate Playbook & Examples - Spacelift
summary: Learn how to use Ansible, a powerful and flexible tool for automating and orchestrating cloud and on-premises infrastructure. This guide covers basic concepts, installation, inventory, ad hoc commands, playbooks, roles, and more.

title: Ansible - GeeksforGeeks
summary: Ansible is an open-source IT engine that automates application deployment, cloud provisioning, intra-service orchestration, and other IT tools. It is an automation and orchestration tool popular for the following reasons: . Simple to Install. Free and open source. Lightweight and consistent. OpenSSH security features make it very secure. What Is Ansible?

title: What is Ansible? - Opensource.com
summary: Ansible is a software tool that provides simple but powerful automation for cross-platform computer support. It is primarily intended for IT professionals, who use it for application deployment, updates on workstations and servers, cloud provisioning, configuration management, intra-service orchestration, and nearly anything a systems administrator does on a weekly or daily basis.

summary: Key Concepts. Ansible: Ansible is an IT automation tool written in Python, primarily focused on infrastructure management and configuration. Inventory: A file defining the systems Ansible will manage, typically including their IP addresses, hostnames, or cloud resource IDs.

title: Loops ‚Äî Ansible Community Documentation
summary: Loops . Ansible offers the loop, with_, and until keywords to execute a task multiple times. Examples of commonly-used loops include changing ownership on several files and/or directories with the file module, creating multiple users with the user module, and repeating a polling step until a certain result is reached.

title: Ansible Basics - Documentation - Rocky Linux
summary: The Ansible vocabulary¬∂. The management machine: the machine on which Ansible is installed.Since Ansible is agentless, no software is deployed on the managed servers.; The managed nodes: the target devices that Ansible manages are also referred to as "hosts."These can be servers, network appliances, or any other computer. The inventory: a file containing information about the managed servers.
